French Quote: Il est certain que la question ordinaire et extraordinaire formait une épreuve décisive et souveraine.
English Translation: It is certain that ordinary and extraordinary torture constituted a decisive and sovereign trial.
Commentary: Hugo critiques the belief that torture could lead to justice, exposing the absurd and brutal nature of the practice.

French Quote: L'aveu arraché par la douleur passait pour infaillible.
English Translation: A confession wrung by pain was regarded as infallible.
Commentary: The idea that pain guarantees truth is condemned as both illogical and inhumane.

French Quote: Il est toujours bon de mettre un peu de l'enfer dans la justice.
English Translation: It is always good to put a bit of hell into justice.
Commentary: A bitterly ironic remark that condemns the cruelty normalized within the justice system.

French Quote: Le lecteur peut ne pas croire ces détails; mais qu’il consulte les monuments judiciaires du temps, il verra que nous n’avons rien exagéré.
English Translation: The reader may not believe these details; but let him consult the judicial records of the time, and he will see that we have not exaggerated anything.
Commentary: Hugo defends his historical accuracy, emphasizing the horrifying reality of medieval legal practices.

French Quote: On avait tant de foi dans la question, qu’on n’eût pas hésité à la faire subir à Dieu.
English Translation: People had such faith in torture that they would not have hesitated to subject God himself to it.
Commentary: This hyperbolic image highlights the blind fanaticism of those who upheld torture as an instrument of justice.
